Hello,
I'm Dmytro!

I'm a front-end developer based in Ukraine. I can develop responsive websites from scratch and raise them into the modern user-friendly web experience

For my long, 4 years lasting journey in the web-development I have developed a lot of very different websites: from simple landing pages to complex web-applications based on ReactJS.

I believe, that modern-days websites should have these features: fast loading speed, excellent screen responsiveness, general accessibility and pleasantly animated interface. And I truly can provide all of these things.

Do you need a landing page for your product? Maybe you want to raise your company reputation onto the next level and you need a website to achieve this goal? Just tell me what you want and consider it's done.

Technologies

Below you can see the list of the technologies that I work with

Hover over a technology's preview to expand the detailed information

High level

I have mastered these technologies on a very high level. It's not easy to find a developer who knows all the niceties of these technologies better than I do

  • HTML

    Deep knowledge of the semantic markup. BEM methodology

  • CSS

    Modern styling approaches. Responsive and performance markup. Animations

Experienced level

I have a pretty decent experience in using these tools and I can do almost everything that you may need

  • JavaScript

    Working with the primitive values, arrays, objects, classes and functions. JS standard library in the web-browsers (DOM, AJAX, etc.)

  • Sass

    Mixins, functions, loops, variables, nesting

  • webpack

    I use it to bundle the .html, .scss and .js files into a web-application. Multiple entry points, code splitting and other cool features. Improving of the loading speed and overall web experience. This website has been created via webpack 5

  • gulp.js

    If your team uses gulp to bundle markup and styles files, I can work with your template

  • Bootstrap

    I can create a website using only Bootstrap 5 library

  • GSAP

    The most popular library for the JavaScript animations. Almost all of the animations on this website (especially scroll-triggered) has been created via GSAP

  • SVG

    I can work with .svg files from your Figma, XD or Illustrator design template. I can modify it, create it from scratch, or make some animations, like changing color, size or make a "drawing" effect

Basic level

I have some basic skills in using these technologies. I can do a job, which is related to them, or improve my knowledge to a better level on a short term

  • React

    I was working with ReactJS three years ago. I've made a few web-applications using React, Redux and Firebase. Later I had to stop using React, because I needed to learn JavaScript better. I still remember the basic principes of how it works though. So now, when I know JS a lot better, I want to learn ReactJS again from the start.

  • Node.js

    I know the bases of Node.js. I know, how it works and what it is capable on. But since I'm a front-end developer, I don't need to know more than how to create a node application and use npm

  • jQuery

    I was working with it 4 years ago, mainly to manipulate the DOM. Nowadays jQuery is not a very necessary library, but if you have a project, which uses jQuery, I can work with it

  • Rollup

    I've got familiarized with Rollup a few months ago and I like it! Very fast, very convenient. If your team uses Rollup instead of webpack, I can work with your template

  • Vite

    Here is the same situation as with the previous tool, since Vite is built on top of Rollup

  • Babel

    I use Babel in every project where I use webpack. I know what it's used for. The default settings, shown on its website, are enough for my simple needs, so I didn't really dive into the documentation

  • PostCSS

    I use it to work with the styles and I like it for a very big amount of the helpful plugins

  • Less

    I was working with it a few years ago, but decided to use Sass because it is a lot more popular and advanced tool. Still, if your team uses Less, I can use it too

  • EJS

    Template language. I was using it mostly because of the partials, also known as includes

  • Nunjucks

    Template language. I was using it mostly because of the partials, also known as includes

  • Handlebars

    Template language. I was using it mostly because of the partials, also known as includes

  • Git

    I have the knowledges of it on the level, which is just enough for the simple pulls, pushes and pull-requests

  • Figma

    I've got very nice skills of using Figma, as for a front-end developer. Besides of just reading a design template, I can create some basic shapes too. The logotype for this website has beed created in Figma

  • Adobe XD

    I can use it to work with your design template. Very nice and convenient tool. Alternative to Figma

  • Adobe Photoshop

    I was using it from the start of my career to read the design templates. I work with it very well (as for a developer) and even can edit photos (just a little)

  • Adobe Illustrator

    Once I was working with a client, who's design template has been created using the Illustrator. It's definitely not the best choice for the web-design, but I can work with it as well

Experience

My programming and employment experience

2018

I was a high-school student. One day I suddenly got intersted in the web-development and very fast it became my hobby. For the next few years in the free time I was developing UI for landing pages, static multipage websites and ReactJS applications just for fun.

2021

For this one year I was working as one of the best online salesman in a very popular ukrainian franchise. What about my development practice, I faced the fact that I really lack the theory knowledges, so I had to pause my actual development process and start to learn. I've read a lot of documentation materials and these new knowledges really help me to develop websites much better.

2022

I've quit my job and decided to pay more attention to my good-old web-development hobby. For this year I have developed a lot of different websites, learnt many new technologies and development best practices and became a freelancer on Upwork.

2023

Now I'm still developing new websites and improving my skills every day. And, by the way, looking for a job, so why don't you e-mail me if you have any proposition?

Performance

Alongside with the responsiveness and the animations, performance is the thing that I pay attention to the most during the development

You can see the animations and the responsiveness with the naked eye. And what about the performance? By the performance I mean high FPS value during the attendance of a website, which means that I have to use very specific approaches in styling. In the front-end development, there are a lot of ways to achieve the same goal, but only an experienced developer knows, what they should use to prevent FPS drops and a long rendering time.

Except of the overall smoothness of a website, not less important are such criterios as fast loading speed, accessability and SEO. To improve these measures, I use the PageSpeed Insights, a service by Google. I have mastered the using of it, so I guarantee very high, 80+ points, measurement values.

Conclusion

As you can see by now, I'm quite a good front-end developer. I can create a marvelous landing page or multipage website. I can use for it your Figma/XD/Photoshop design template or just your idea/example. I can do it in various ways, depending on your needs. I can do it fast and qualitatively. And if you want me to do it, just contact me.
